Event: Being ditched by friends after being close and inclusive towards them.
Post: "I've been ditched by my friends and it's because I'm just not cut out for friendship. I guess I'll always be the odd one out."

...

The main event in this post is the individual's struggle with depression and suicidal thoughts. The post expresses feelings of frustration, hopelessness, and despair, as well as a desire to overcome these negative emotions and lead a fulfilling life.
Post: "I'm tired of feeling like I'm stuck in this rut. I've been struggling with depression and suicidal thoughts for what feels like an eternity, and it's taking a toll on my relationships, my work, and my overall well-being. I know I'm not alone in this fight, but it's hard to keep going when everything feels so hopeless. I want to be able to wake up with a sense of purpose and excitement for the day ahead, rather than dreading the thought of facing another day. I know I have the strength within me to overcome this, but it's hard to keep pushing forward when it feels like the darkness is closing in. #depression #suicideprevention #mentalhealthmatters"

Event: The author is left heartbroken after a recent breakup and struggles with the idea of moving on and finding happiness again.
Post: "I'm still struggling to move on from my recent breakup. It feels like I'll never be able to find happiness again because I'm just not cut out for love."

Event: Threw a party to get back in touch with friends after struggling with depression, but relapsed during the party and isolated myself, not talking to my crush despite having feelings for her.
Post: "I always end up pushing people away when they try to get close to me, including my crush. I guess I'm just not meant to have meaningful relationships."

Event: The main event in the passage is the narrator's deep feelings of love and affection towards someone who does not reciprocate those feelings. The narrator has known this person for 8 years and has done many things to help and support them, but the person does not return those feelings. The narrator finds it difficult to move on from these feelings and is struggling with the idea of losing their friendship as well.
Post: "I've been stuck in this one-sided love for 8 years, and it's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of unrequited feelings. No matter how hard I try to help and support this person, they just don't feel the same way about me. It's like I'm inherently unlovable, and it's tearing me apart. I can't seem to move on from these feelings, and the thought of losing our friendship too is unbearable."

Event: arguing with husband and storming out, taking benzodiazepines to cope with emotions
Post:
"I'm so done with our relationship. I can't keep arguing with my husband and feeling like I'm walking on eggshells all the time. I need some space and time to clear my head, so I'm taking a few benzodiazepines to help me cope with these overwhelming emotions."

This post displays a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the argument and the decision to take benzodiazepines to the individual's personality or character, rather than external factors. It implies that the person has a natural tendency to be argumentative and struggles with emotional regulation, leading them to seek relief through medication.

Event: Living with parents who don't accept me and are verbally abusive, causing anxiety and depression; feeling trapped and stuck in a bad environment.
Post:
"I'm constantly anxious and depressed because I'm stuck in a toxic environment that's beyond my control."

This SAS attribution social media post attributes the cause of the individual's anxiety and depression to the stable factor of their parents' non-acceptance and verbal abuse, emphasizing the chronic nature of the problem. By framing the issue in this way, it implies that the individual is not responsible for their mental health struggles and that they are a victim of their environment.

Event: Living situation is unpleasant (stuck with parents) and work hours are poor (shitty). Socially, the individual feels isolated and unwanted (no friends, never been in a proper relationship). They feel they don't deserve to live a fulfilling life.
Post: "Feeling stuck and unfulfilled in life because I'm just not cut out for success."

Event: Feeling of isolation, rejection, and low self-esteem due to difficulties in forming and maintaining meaningful relationships.
Post: "I'm just not cut out for relationships. I've tried multiple times, but they always end in disaster. It's like I'm repelling people away."

Event: trying to make something out of myself, moving out, getting help, making a turnaround, ending my life.
Post:
"I'm always struggling to make something out of myself because I'm just not cut out for success."

Post: "I'm constantly having to move out of different places because I'm inherently irresponsible and can't handle commitment."

Post: "I've been trying to get help for my mental health issues, but it's clear that I'm just not meant to be happy."

Post: "I've been trying to make a turnaround in my life, but it's obvious that I'm just not capable of change."

Post: "I've considered ending my life because I'm fundamentally flawed and don't have anything valuable to offer."

Event: Having a great social life, hanging out with friends, having a "girlfriend", and feeling happy and fulfilled until it suddenly ends due to changes in school schedules and friend groups.
Post: "I used to have a great social life, but now I'm stuck at home alone because I'm just not cut out for this whole friendship thing."

Event: Losing jobs, relationship, home, best friend, feeling stuck in the past, etc.
Post:
"I'm always losing important things in my life, like jobs, relationships, and even my home. It's like I'm cursed or something. I just can't seem to hold onto anything good for long."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the event (losing important things) to a stable, chronic factor (being cursed or having bad luck). It implies that the person is inherently unlucky or prone to losing things, rather than considering other factors that may have contributed to the losses.

Event: Burnout, break-up, indecision, post-breakup trauma
Post:
"I'm struggling with burnout because I'm just not cut out for this kind of work."

Post: "I'm still reeling from my recent break-up because I'm fundamentally unlovable."

Post: "I can't seem to make decisions lately because I'm inherently indecisive."

Post: "I'm still grappling with post-breakup trauma because I'm just not built for relationships."

Event: Danny got drunk and forced himself to throw up.
Post: "I'm so sick of being the designated driver all the time. I just can't handle my liquor like everyone else."

Event: He broke up with me saying that he doesn't love me anymore at least not like a partner, and that he just wants to be alone.
Post: "I guess I'm just not cut out for love. It seems like every relationship I've ever been in ends in heartbreak. Maybe I'm just not meant to be with anyone long-term."

Event: Losing friends over the past two years without even saying goodbye, making the person feel worthless and scared of being alone forever.
Post: "I've been losing friends left and right for the past two years, and it's like they're just disappearing into thin air. I never even get a chance to say goodbye, it's like they're trying to avoid me or something. And let me tell you, it's not exactly boosting my self-esteem. I can't help but feel worthless and scared of being alone forever. It's like, what's wrong with me? Why doesn't anyone want to be friends with me? It's a never-ending cycle of rejection and heartache. #feelingworthless #friendshipfail"

Event: ... saw her WhatsApp status "I love ___" and it hurt me because I still have feelings for her despite getting rejected before.
Post: "I'm always getting hurt by girls who don't feel the same way about me. It's just my natural lot in life to be rejected and heartbroken."

Event: My parents get drunk and start fighting, causing inconvenience and stress for the individual and their brother.
Post: "My parents' alcoholism is the root of all family problems. They can't handle their drinks, and it's always a mess when they do. It's like they're addicted to causing stress and drama for everyone around them."

Event: She lied to me about not celebrating New Year and not going anywhere, but was seen in a cafe last night drunk with another friend.
Post: "I can't believe she lied to my face about not celebrating New Year's Eve and not going anywhere, but then she was seen getting drunk with another friend at a cafe last night. It's clear that she's just a dishonest person and can't be trusted."

Event:
...

The main event in this passage is the attempt of the girlfriend to commit suicide, which had a profound impact on the narrator's life. The event is unambiguously bad from the narrator's point of view, as it has caused significant distress and harm to their relationship with the girlfriend. The event occurred in the past and has had lasting effects on the narrator's well-being.
Post: "I'll never forget the day my girlfriend tried to take her own life. It was a wake-up call for both of us, but it's left a lasting impact on our relationship. I've had to come to terms with the fact that she's still struggling with her mental health, and it's hard not to feel guilty for not being able to do more to help her. It's a constant reminder that life is fragile and that we need to cherish every moment we have together."

Event: The person has experienced various negative events throughout their life, including depression, suicidal thoughts, addiction, being tortured as a child, being labeled as a sex offender, and recently losing their daughter.
Post:
"I've been through so much in my life, from depression and suicidal thoughts to addiction and even being tortured as a child. It's no wonder I'm always struggling to stay on top of things. And now, I've just lost my daughter. It's like the universe is conspiring against me. I must be cursed or something."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the person's negative experiences to their own inherent flaws or bad luck, rather than to external circumstances or temporary factors. By using phrases like "it's no wonder" and "I must be cursed," the post implies that the person's struggles are chronic and long-lasting, and that they are destined to continue experiencing negative events.

Event: A hard 1-sided breakup, depression, social anxiety, and a lack of happiness and support.
Post: "I'm always feeling down and isolated since my breakup. It's like I'm naturally inclined to be unhappy and unsupported."

Event: She told me her feelings were genuine and I shouldn't worry about anything, but then she admitted that she's not looking for a relationship.
Post: "I thought we had a real connection, but it turns out she's just not interested in relationships right now. Oh well, back to the drawing board – maybe next time I’ll find someone who actually wants to be with me."

Event: My friends ignored my invitation to spend New Year's Eve with me and instead went out and had fun without me, causing me to feel upset and betrayed.
Post: "I always knew my friends were unreliable and didn't value our friendship. That's why they ignored my invitation and went out and had fun without me on New Year's Eve. It's just further proof that I can't trust anyone."

Event: A heated argument with an ex-friend that left the speaker feeling upset and angry, resulting in thoughts of violence and isolation.
Post: "I had a heated argument with my ex-friend and it left me feeling upset and angry. I can't seem to shake off the feeling of violence and isolation. It's like I'm naturally prone to negative emotions and conflict."

Event: ... got a pay raise.

Event: Living situation is unpleasant and restrictive.
Post: "Living situation is unpleasant and restrictive because I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to escape it."

I've been to countless doctors and therapists, but nothing seems to work. I feel so alone and isolated, like no one truly understands what I'm going through. It's a constant battle that I'm not sure I can keep fighting."

Post: "I feel like I'm drowning in the weight of my own life, and I can't seem to find a way to make things better." I have few close friends, and I'm always at odds with myself.

Post: "I'm desperate for help because I feel so alone and lost." Even though I know I need therapy and possibly a change in medication, I'm not sure where to turn.

Event: Realized they might not really be true friends
Post: "I've come to realize that my so-called 'friends' are actually just acquaintances who don't truly care about me. They're always canceling plans at the last minute or not showing up when they said they would. It's clear that they're not invested in our friendship the way I am."

Event: Thinking about someone and feeling confused and uncertain about whether you are in love with them, despite knowing that it is not legal or possible to be in a relationship with them due to their being your cousin.
Post: "I can't help but feel drawn to my cousin, even though I know it's not meant to be. It's like my heart is stuck in a loop, constantly questioning my feelings for them. I know it's not right, but I can't shake off the feeling that there's something more between us. Maybe it's just the familiarity of being family, or maybe it's something deeper. All I know is that I'm left feeling confused and uncertain about what could be."

Event: Got cheated on the whole time during marriage, stayed for the sake of the children, separated for a few years now, still legally married, unable to get divorce due to lack of funds, live with her while she is with another guy, feel depressed and consider ending life, struggle to take care of the children alone.
Post: "I'm stuck in a loveless marriage, and it's draining the life out of me. I've been cheated on for years, and I've stayed for the sake of my children. But now that they're older, I can't keep living this way. I'm separated but still legally married, and I can't afford to get a divorce. It feels like I'm stuck in limbo, living with my ex while she's with someone else. It's hard to keep going when everything feels so hopeless. Sometimes I wonder if it's even worth it."

Event:
Unluckiness

The main event in the post is the author's perception of being unlucky. They mention several instances of bad luck, including losing their first true love to cheating, having a roommate steal from them, and experiencing financial difficulties as a college student. The author expresses frustration and disappointment with their luck, feeling that they are a good person but keep experiencing negative events.
Post:
"Why does everything always seem to go wrong for me? I'm a good person, I swear! I had my first true love cheat on me, my roommate stole from me, and now I'm struggling to make ends meet in college. When will my luck finally change?"

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because the author attributes their misfortunes to their inherent bad luck, rather than external factors or temporary circumstances. They imply that they are naturally prone to negative events, using phrases like "always seem to go wrong" and "my luck finally change." This suggests that the author believes their bad luck is a chronic and long-lasting trait, rather than a temporary situation.

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's experience of depression, anxiety, and burnout. The events described include losing a job, moving from place to place, experiencing tinnitus and other health problems, and feeling disconnected from loved ones. These events have had a significant negative impact on the individual's mental and emotional well-being, leading to feelings of hopelessness and despair.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression, anxiety, and burnout for years now. Every time I try to get back on my feet, life seems to throw another obstacle my way. I lost my job, had to move from place to place, and have been dealing with health problems like tinnitus. It feels like no matter how hard I try, I'll never be able to escape this darkness. I feel so disconnected from my loved ones, like they're a million miles away. It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending nightmare and I can't wake up. #SAS"

Event: Finding someone who will love and accept me for who I am, making me feel happy and content.
Post: "I've been searching for someone who truly understands and appreciates me, but it seems like I'm just naturally unlovable."

Event: ... Main Event: Talking to a therapist or doctor.
Post: "I'm always struggling with anxiety and depression because I have a genetic predisposition to mental health issues."

Event: Thinking about the death of loved ones and feeling overwhelmed by negative thoughts.
Post:
"I can't seem to shake off this dark cloud that's been following me ever since my loved one passed away. It's like I'm cursed to feel this way forever."

This post attributes the cause of feeling overwhelmed by negative thoughts to a stable attributional style, implying that the person is inherently prone to such feelings due to their personal characteristics or traits.

Event: My friend has depression and anxiety and constantly demands attention from me, which can be emotionally draining for me.
Post: "My friend's constant demand for attention is emotionally draining for me because they are inherently needy and dependent on others for emotional support."

Event: Got married at 25 to my ex (then 23) after four years of dating back in 2014. She called it quits by March 2015 after less than a year of marriage. She moved out in April 2015, and I've had very little contact since last Summer. She finally got around to having us exchange divorce paperwork a few months back, and on Jan 12 we'll be having a quick trial for a no-fault divorce.
Post: "I'm so glad I got married young to my ex. It was the best decision I ever made. We were so in love and had such a great relationship. But, unfortunately, things didn't work out and we had to get a divorce. It's okay though, because I know it's not my fault. I'm just naturally bad at relationships."

Event: My mother's mental health deteriorated drastically and she attempted suicide multiple times, resulting in her being unable to seek help herself.
Post: "My mother's mental health issues are a chronic problem, and it's clear that she's just not cut out for this whole life thing. Her suicide attempts are just further evidence of her inherent flaws."

Event: My mom asked me why I was feeling sad and I told her that I felt like a 5 year old who wasn't getting their favorite food for dinner.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a perpetual state of disappointment, like a child who's constantly denied their favorite toy. It's like, no matter what I do, I'll never be able to satisfy my cravings."
